name: ProShares UltraShort Gold
description: ProShares UltraShort Gold (BIS) is an exchange-traded fund (ETF) that seeks to provide investors with a daily investment return that is double the inverse performance of the daily price movement of gold bullion, as measured by the London Gold Fix Price. Launched in 2008, BIS allows investors to capitalize on the volatility of gold prices while hedging against downturns in the gold market. The fund is designed for short-term trading and is particularly appealing to traders looking to profit from declines in gold prices or to hedge other investments in gold-related assets. ProShares, the issuer of BIS, is known for pioneering the ETF industry and offers a range of funds that provide exposure to various asset classes and investment strategies. BIS is actively managed and uses derivatives such as futures contracts to achieve its investment objective. Investors should be aware that due to the daily resetting of leverage, holding this ETF for longer periods may result in performance that diverges significantly from the intended inverse exposure over time. As such, it is primarily suited for sophisticated investors who closely monitor market movements and are comfortable with the risks associated with leveraged and inverse ETFs.
